28.44.text: Hello. Tonight, we meet two more teams whom we fully expect

32.60.text: to have spent the last few weeks bonding, swotting

35.36.text: and avoiding cracks in the pavement

37.56.text: in the hope of earning themselves a place in the second round.

42.52.text: The losers may qualify to play again if their score puts them

45.44.text: among the four highest-scoring losing teams

48.08.text: from these first-round matches, so crack on with it.

51.60.text: The University of Nottingham began life in the 19th century

54.68.text: as a constituent college of London University,

57.84.text: with its foundation stone laid by Gladstone in 1877.

61.32.text: In the 1920s, it moved from the city centre

63.76.text: to a campus on the outskirts of the city

66.32.text: following an endowment by Sir Jesse Boot of Boots The Chemist fame.

70.84.text: It received its royal charter in 1948

73.32.text: and alumni include the writer DH Lawrence,

78.04.text: who won the Nobel Prize for his work on magnetic resonance imaging,

82.20.text: and the head of the high-street shoe repair chain John Timpson.

94.56.text: Originally from South London and I'm studying medicine.

97.72.text: Hi. I'm Ben Scrafield. I'm from Sheffield and I'm studying chemistry.

101.20.text:
- This is their captain. 
- Hi. I'm Alice Lilly.

103.60.text: I'm from Harrogate in North Yorkshire

105.44.text: and I'm studying for a PhD in American Studies.

109.08.text: Hi. I'm Mark Dennis. I'm from Hucknall in Nottinghamshire

112.00.text: and I'm studying for a PhD in mathematics.

118.36.text: Now, the University of Swansea is making a long-overdue appearance

122.08.text: in this competition, having last been seen in 1997.

126.04.text: It was the fourth constituent college of the University of Wales,

129.40.text: receiving its charter from George V in 1920 with 89 students,

134.76.text: a whole eight of them female, enrolling that year.

139.64.text: and, in 2007, it became a university in its own right.

143.36.text: Alumni include the writer and broadcaster Mavis Nicholson,

146.84.text: Richey Edwards and Nicky Wire of the Manic Street Preachers

151.96.text: project leader at CERN's Large Hadron Collider.

155.48.text: Tonight's team are representing around 18,000 fellow students.

159.12.text: They have an average age of 29 and a captain who tells us

162.88.text: that appearing on this programme has been on his bucket list

167.88.text: Let's hope it's all he's ever dreamed of.

170.52.text: So, we ask the team now to introduce themselves.

173.56.text: Hello. My name is Georgia Pigott.

175.40.text: I'm from Cannock in Staffordshire and I'm studying medicine.
